detaileddescription.para: The number identifying a Res object. Because it is a class variable each Res will get its own ID number starting by zero.
The ID number of this Res object.
The vector holding all the pairs (used resources of this Res, the Sim-process which holds the resources at the moment). See: inner class UsedResources
The vector holding all the resources of this resource pool not used at the moment.
The resource database keeping track of which SimProcesses holding which resources and SimPorcesses requesting resources.
To indicate whether the check for deadlocks is active or not. Default is true= deadlock check enabled.
Is set to true if a deadlock is detected where this Res is involved in. Otherwise it remains false. Default is false.
The number of resources in the Res (capacity)
The minimum number of resources being available
Number of resources available at the moment
Number of processes having acquired and released one or more resources
Weighted sum of available resources (in the Res over the time)
The last time the Res has been used
Counter for the SimProcesses which are refused to be enqueued, because the queue capacity is full.
Indicates the method where something has gone wrong. Is passed as a parameter to the method checkProcess().
Flag to indicate whether an entity can pass by other entities in the queue which are enqueued before that entity in the queue. Is false as default value.
The queue, actually storing the processes waiting for resources

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, int sortOrder, int qCapacity, int capacity, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: Res

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a Res with a number of initial resources in it. The queueing discipline and the capacity limit of the underlying queue can be chosen, too.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this Res is associated to.
java.lang.String : The Res's name
int : determines the sort order of the underlying queue implementation. Choose a constant from QueueBased like QueueBased.FIFO or QueueBased.LIFO or ...
int : The capacity of the queue, that is how many processes can be enqueued. Zero (0) means unlimited capacity.
int : The number of resources the Res starts with. Must be positive and greater than 0.
boolean : Flag, if Res should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, int capacity, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: Res

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a Res with a number of initial resources in it. The underlying queue has a Fifo queueing discipline and unlimited capacity.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this Res is associated to.
java.lang.String : The Res's name
int : The number of resources the Res starts with. Must be positive and greater than 0.
boolean : Flag, if Res should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the average usage of the Res. That means: in average, which percentage of the resources were in use over the time?

simplesect.para: double : the average usage of the resources in the Res.

detaileddescription.para: Changes the limit of the available resources in the Res. Sets the number of the maximum available resources to m. m must be positive. This is only allowed as long as the Res has not been used or the Res has just been reset.

parameterdescription.para: int : The new limit (capacity) of the Res. Must be positive.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a Reporter to produce a report about this Res.

simplesect.para: desmoj.report.Reporter : The Reporter for the queue inside this Res.

detaileddescription.para: Turns the deadlock check off. So whenever a SimProcess can not get the resources desired, there won't be checked if a deadlock situation might have occured.
Turns the deadlock check on. So whenever a SimProcess can not get the resources desired, it will be checked if a deadlock situation might occur.
Returns the number of resources available in the pool at the moment.

simplesect.para: int : The number of resources available at the moment.

detaileddescription.para: Returns if the deadlock check is enabled (true) or not ( false).

simplesect.para: boolean :true if the deadlock check is enabled, false if the deadlock check is not enabled

detaileddescription.para: Returns the ID number of this Res object.

simplesect.para: long : The ID number of this Res object.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the initial number of resources in the Res pool.

simplesect.para: int : The initial number of resources in the Res pool at the beginning.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the minimum number of resources in the Res.

simplesect.para: int : The minimum number of resources in the Res.

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

simplesect.para: boolean : Indicates whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the QueueList actually storing the SimProcesses waiting for resources.

simplesect.para: desmoj.QueueList : the queue actually storing the SimProcesses waiting for resources.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the implemented queueing discipline of the underlying queue as a String, so it can be displayed in the report.

simplesect.para: String : The String indicating the queueing discipline.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue, because the capacity limit is reached.

simplesect.para: long : The number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of users.

simplesect.para: long : The number of Users. That are processes having acquired and released resources.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if a deadlock is detected, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: boolean : is true if a deadlock is detected, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Gets a number of n resources from the Res pool and provides them to the Sim-process to use them. Hint for developers: calls the private method deliver(). As not enough resources are available at the moment the SimProcess has to wait in a queue until enough products are available again.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the specified number of resources have been provided successfully, false otherwise (i.e. capacity limit of the queue is reached).

parameterdescription.para: int : The number of resources the resourcepool will provide() to the SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Resets the statistics of this Res. The number of available resources at this moment and the processes waiting in the queue are not changed. But all statistic counters are reset. The parent QueueBased is also reset.

Sets the boolean field deadlockDetected to the given value. If a deadlock for this Res is detected when an unsuccessfull seize statement for a resource has taken place, then the value of deadlockDetected will be set to true. The value will also been shown in the report of this Res.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : the new value for the field deadlockDetected. Should be true if this Res is involved in a deadlock.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the flag passBy to a new value. PassBy is indicating whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value of passBy. Set it to true if you want entities to pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue. Set it to false if you don't want entities to overtake other entities in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: A process is using this method to put resources it has used back in the Res pool. The process can not put more resources back than it has acquired once. The array of returning resources can be provided by the method returnResources() of the class SimProcess.

parameterdescription.para: Resource[] : The array of resources a process is returning to the resource pool. Can't be more resources than it once has acquired!

detaileddescription.para: A process is using this method to put resources it has used back in the Res pool. The process can not put more resources back than it has acquired once. This method can be used as an alternative to the method takeBack(Resource[] returnedRes) in cases that the user does not want to provide an array of returning resources. This method is also compatible with older DESMO-J Versions.

parameterdescription.para: int : The number of resources which should be returned to the Res pool. Can't be more than once were acquired!

detaileddescription.para: Activates the SimProcess process, given as a parameter of this method, as the next process. This process should be a SimProcess waiting in the queue for some resources.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The process that is to be activated as next.

detaileddescription.para: Activates the first process waiting in the queue. That is a process which was trying to acquire resources, but there were not enough left in the Res. Or another process was first in the queue to be served. This method is called every time a process returns resources or when a process in the waiting-queue is satisfied.
Checks whether the process using the Res is a valid process.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns whether the SimProcess is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : Is this SimProcess a valid one?

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of resources held by the given SimProcess at this time.

simplesect.para: int : The number of resources held by the given SimProcess at this time.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The SimProcess which is expected to hold some Resources.

detaileddescription.para: Muss durch eine andere Methode in SimProcess ersetzt werden ???
Soenke ????

A process is using this method to return all the resources it holds to the Res pool. The process can not put more resources back than it has acquired once. This method can be used if a Process is about to be terminated.
public void takeBackAll () { where = "void takeBackAll ()";
int n = 0; // how many resources will be taken back
Sim-process currentProcess = currentSimProcess();

if (!checkProcess(currentProcess, where)) //check the current process { return; } // if it is not valid just return // delete the entry of the currentSimProcess in the arrayOfUsedResources // search the whole vector for ( int i = 0; i < arrayOfUsedResources.size(); i++) { // get hold of the UsedResources pair (SimProcess/number of resources) UsedResources procHoldRes = (UsedResources)arrayOfUsedResources.elementAt(i);
if (procHoldRes.getProcess() == currentProcess) { // number of resources held by the currentProcess n = procHoldRes.getOccupiedResources ();
arrayOfUsedResources.removeElementAt(i); // delete the entry } } // end for
updateStatistics ( n ); // statistics will be updated
users++; // update users // tell in the trace that the process is releasing all its resources if ( traceIsOn() ) { sendTraceNote ( "releases all its " + n + " " + this.getName() ); }
activateNext(); // give waiting process in the queue a chance } Updates the arrayOfUsedResources for this Res whenever resources are provided.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The current SimProcess acquiring resources.
Resource[] : The array of resources the Res is providing to the current SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the statistics for the Res whenever resources are provided or "takenBack".

parameterdescription.para: int : Is positive when the Res takeBack() resources and negative when the Res provides() resources.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the arrayOfUsedResources for this Res whenever resources are taken back.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The current SimProcess releasing resources.
Resource[] : The array of resources the Res will take back from the current SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a number of n resources from the Res pool and delivers this array of resources to the Simprocess to use them. Is called from the method provide (int n).

parameterdescription.para: int : The number of resources the resourcepool will deliver() to the SimProcess.

simplesect.para: Resource[] : the array of resources which will be delivered to the SimProcess.

detaileddescription.para: Res is the place where resources are stored in a pool. Processes can come by and the resource pool will provide() resources to them. Each process has to give back the same resources it once has acquired by calling the takeBack() method of the Res. Res is used to implement process synchronization between processes, which are using resources. The resource pool has a limited capacity. A process can acquire one or more resources and use them. After usage the process must release this or these same resources to make them available to other processes. If a process can not get the number of resources needed, it has to wait in a queue until enough resources are released by other processes. A process can release its resources anytime. After the resourcepool has "takenBack"() the used resources the waiting-queue is checked for processes waiting for them. The first sort criteria of the queue is always highest priorities first, the second queueing discipline of the underlying queue and the capacity limit can be determined by the user (default is FIFO and unlimited capacity). Under certain circumstances a deadlock might block some waiting

QueueBased
